data.title: Family History Kingston upon Hull Yorkshire, East Riding 301
data.text:
Codd

My great great grandad WILLIAM CODD was born in Hull, according to census information in 1853. He married MARY MOODY 02 October 1876 in Hull. His father is named as JESSE CODD and Mary's father as JAMES MOODY. I am unable to find a GRO reference for the births of William or Mary. Any help would be appreciated. George Henry Alcock

Looking for information on George Henry Alcock, born in Hull 25 Jan 1910, died St Leonards on Sea 13 May 1986. Marriage to Mabel Boynton 22 Dec 1935 in Hull when listed as fish fryer, but became hotelier and owned a hotel in London in 1950s. Father Jabez Alcock (born 1886 in Hull from a family originating in Longham, Norfolk), mother Ethel Meada Johnson. Any information most welcome. Wenman,Bannister

I am looking for a half sister. Result of my fathers 2nd marriage. Roland Raymond Wenman married Annie A Bannister in 1956, they had a daughter, Wendy, who I believe is my half sister. Anyone with any info please? Brantons

Looking to find anyone with further information on William Branton born abt. 1818 Patrington. He married Elizabeth Leake B. abt. 1816 Balkholme, Howden. I believe Elizabeth died abt. 1903 in Hull. Their children were ANN ELIZABETH BRANTON abt. 1849, EDWARD TOYNE BRANTON 5 December 1841, ROBERT BRANTON 6 December 1845, MARY BRANTON August 10 1846, JANE BRANTON abt. 1851, THOMAS L BRANTON abt. 1845, JOHN HENRY BRANTON abt 1857, if my dates are correct! ANN ELIZABETH Married George Green b.1848 Hull and had children WILLIAM BRANTON GREEN 25 Sept 1875, THOMAS 1871, LAURA ETHEL 1872, EDMUND 1877, ANNE 1880, HARRY 1882, & finally ARTHUR VINES

Looking for any info re Walter Sherard VINES who was Prof of English Literature at University College, Hull from 1929 to 1952ish and also a well known poet and writer in his day. Particularly interested to trace any children of his; acording to Who's Who he was married twice, first wife's name unknown but they had a daughter (name also unknown), second wife Agnes Rennie Cumming whom he married in 1930 and they had a child (daughter?) called Rennie J Vines b 1933. Walter was b 1890 the eldest son of Professor Sydney Howard Vines prof of Botany at Oxford; he had a sister Margaret Beaufort Vines, and a younger brother Howard William Copland Vines who became Prof of Pathology at London University. Any info re their descendants also gratefully received. grayson/Denine

Hi looking for any info on the graysons(sculcoates area) originally from ripon area watermen thomas henry grayson married Catherine Denine(born newfoundland}2 daughters Elizabeth born 1896 she married Daniel Johnston Catherine Mary born c 1898 married and as far as I know had children wonder if there was some rift as never mentioned but do recollect when I was younger a niece visiting my gran and still living in the hull area in the 1970s hoping someone has a connection as they might be able to tell me a bit about the Denine and Grayson family Austin Families

I am looking for descendents of 3 AUSTIN brothers who moved to Hull from Barrow and Barton on Humber between 1890 and 1901 . In 1901 : ROBERT STAMPER AUSTIN ( my Gx2 grandfather ) a Dock Labourer living in Raven Street Hedon Road , JOSEPH ROBERT AUSTIN , Dock Labourer , Haller Street and WILLIAM HENRY AUSTIN , Coal Heaver , Goulton Street Their father was GEORGE AUSTIN a Brickyard labourer who had lived in various villages in N. Lincs before settling in Barrow on Humber c. 1881 Two other brothers JOHN and TOM stayed in Barton & Barrow GREEN/CLAXTON

I have been trying to trace the following people: William Robert GREEN Born 1871 Married 15th July 1902 to Florrie CLAXTON Florrie's Mother name = Mary Ruth Beverley Florrie's Father name = William Henry Claxton I found William Robert in the 1881 Census, details are; 9 Seaton Terce, Sculcoates, York Head = Mary L. Green (Female aged 44) Son = William R. Green (Male aged 10) Daur = Esma E. Green (Female aged 6) Visitor = Agnes J. Norwood (Femail aged 17) My grandfather last received a letter from William Robert GREEN (his father) in 1939. I would love to hear from anyone with any connections... George Joseph Johnson and Emmie Hepple

Hi I am looking for information on my great grandad he was born in Hull around 1906 and am currently searching for information about him and my great grandma Emmie Hepple please if you have any information regarding either please contact me. SMITH FAMILY - BUTCHERS

I am looking on behalf of my Grandfather (Alfred Smith) who is the last remaining family member of the "Smiths Butchers" chain of shops famous in Hull. He left Hull around 1935 and lost contact with the family business. Any information would be gratefully accepted. Johnson and Johnson

In 1854 William Croft Johnson (1834-1909)married Mary Johnson (1836-1885). William's father was Charles Johnson (born 1811), sometime confectioner and later a railway labourer. His mother was probably Phillis. In 1841 Charles and family were living in Alfred Street, Hull. Mary's parents were John (1811-1854?) and Mary (b 1813) Johnson. In 1851 John was described as a Victualler & Bricklayer living in Alfred Street! Were William and the younger Mary related? Can anyone provide any more information on these Johnsons? Wright (Robert and Mary)

William (b. 1835) and Henry (b. 1837), sons of Robert and Mary, were born in Harford House, Howard Lane, Bradford, Yorkshire, England. The two brothers removed to Brewster, MA USA and then Pawtucket, RI USA I can not find this location or family in Bradford, England. I did find in the 1841 Census a family that resembles this living in Reedness, Whitgift, Yorkshire, England. There were no parents listed as living with this family however along with William and Henry (of the right age) are an older sister Mary age 13 and older brother Robert 12 and a 2 year old sister Ellen. However all the U.S. Census records state that William and Henry were born in Hull. Walker, John, of Hull

John Walker, born about 1809, was a seaman who married Esther Hackshaw in 1849. His father was also John, but that's all we know. Grateful for any information on John, his ancestors or collaterals. price chatterton darvell

am trying to find any info on Elsie May Price born May 1898. Her father was believed to be George Price. We think there are links to an E Chatterton and W Chatterton both witnesses at her wedding to Arthur Darvell in Beverley. She had connection to london too. ALSO DOES ANYONE KNOW WHAT A SUNSHINE HOME FOR CHILDREN WAS IN THE 1900S AND HOW I CAN GET INFO ON THEM. Olssen, Watson, Tong, Betts, Longman

Anybody searching for these names in Hull let me know, especially a William Jordan Rice Watson born around 1849 and died around 1872-3 (supposedly) or the Olssen family and in particular Charles Olssen born around 1850 in Gothenburg, Sweden. king jackson

has anyone any information on 'King Jackson' a sailing ship owner and master from Hull in the early 1800's. Who went down with his ship. I am trying to find out if there is any substance to a family tale. thanx jeremy NODDLES

Can anyone help, my grandfather ERNEST HERBERT NODDLES (born 1900)came from Hull. I believe his wife and child died in a zeppllien attack on Hull. Would love some info from any other NODDLES to see if there is a connection Kathleen McLoughlin ( Grandmother)

kathleen mcloughlin (martin) born in Hull parents Charles and Fannny sister mirrium brother charlie John and Tim had older son born Lancashire area, 1940s died tragic along with her five children, she was a very musicle person who played the pianoe and arcordian. could go on for ever about this lovely lady my cousin. the person her grand daughter wanting any information get in touch through curiouse fox. Ashbridge Pinder Marriage

Searching for more information on the following family. I Have a John Ashbridge married to a Hannah Pinder. John born 1816, Hannah born 1817. John is my 4x great grandfather. they were married in 1838 Sculcoates I have no information from an earlier time from this family and about 30 names in connection with this family. My line goes down from his son Thomas Ashbridge born 1843, then his son walter gilbert crackles ashbridge born 1876, then his son Charles Hart Ashbridge, then my grandma Rhoda Constance Ashbridge born 1923 in NZ. any extra information appreciated. Constance Pinkney

I am searching for decendants and relatives of the Pinkney family, some in Hull, or near areas, others in Leeds Yorkshire. Would be pleased to hear from anyone connected to this family as I am only just starting to research this branch and have scant information. Regards Jean RICHARD SIZER Engineers, Hull

My maternal great-great grandfather Charles Thompson Hardy married ELIZA SIZER in Hull in 1857 (marriage record confirmed). It is believed in the family that Eliza was related to the Richard Sizer who founded the engineering company of that name in Hull, but I can't confirm it. There seem to have been only two Sizer families in Hull (Sculcoates) in 1851, one of which included a Richard and a William both of whom were "forge men" and therefore likely to be the founders of Richard Sizer Ltd engineers, but there is no Eliza or Elizabeth in the family. Has anyone researched the Richard Sizer family? Town Clerk

My father Alfred Wilson(1906-1974),son of Alfred and Eleanor, grew up in S.E.London. His father was from Malton Yorkshire, his mother from Sunderland County Durham.He told me that his cousin(surname not known to me) became Town Clerk of Hull. Any clues? Meanwell's in Hull

I am looking for information on my Father's family,Meanwell's who lived in Vine Court High Street Hull,in the 1800's.The Father's name was William married to Mary Groves,their son Richard came out to Australia ,inthe late 1800's and married Julia or Emily Minns.Julia or Emily was the Daughter of George Minns and Merenda Jemina Dunnett,who I believed also lived around Hull,any information would be appreicated. ASHBRIDGE and PINDER Marriage

I am looking for the parents of John ASHBRIDGE who married Hannah PINDER Jun 1838. i have john born 1816 Hull and Hannah pinder born 1817. these are the earliest ASHBRIDGE relatives i have. is anyone elce researching this family? Constance John Dale (1824) Ellen Levitt of Hull

Searching for any information about my Great Great Grandparents John and Ellen Dale nee Levitt They are listed as having two shops a poulterers at 21 Charles Street and in the 1881 census they are residing at 34 Wright Street this is listed as a Ale and Porter Stores. Any information no matter what it is would be very helpful McCunnell

We are researching the McCunnell family.Ellen McCunnell was born in Scotland in 1854.She married John Lang and she died in Hull in 1890.It may be that the surname is really McConnell. Is anyone else researching this family? Bulmer/Tinker/Hodge

I am g-g-g-granddaughter of George Bulmer who married Frances Tinker in about 1830. His son, Thomas, was married to Sarah Hodge, and they were described as "Seed Crushers" in census documents, believed to be involved in oil seed refinery. They lived in or around Sculcoates or Sutton. Of Thomas & Sarah's children, at least one, George Herbert, emigrated to Australia. Does anyone have any information or know of any descendants who might still be living in the Hull area? Looking for my father's past

looking for anyone who is connected to victor olaf johnson born 28/3/ 1911 in hull he was a fisherman up to 1940 he had a brother charles,and a sister ida, any info would be helpful. Rebecca search

help please looking for any info on Alexander michael stephenson Robinson. born 1883 in hull east yorkshire. His father was Charles Andrew Robinson mother Emma Stringer. father was born Ireland and was a house painter. also any inf on Alexander Robinson Customs officer born 1839 Ontario. would like to know where he worked as customs officer. any info on these two much appreciated Regards Barbara. Watts Venning

Thomas Watts married Annie Betsy Venning from Sculcoates, Hull in 1898. They had 3 children, Edith (1899), William Andrew (1901) and Charles Venning Watts (?). I can trace Annie Betsy's side of the family quite well, but Thomas, who may have been John Thomas Watts is a problem. There may have been a Welsh connection (Leckwith, Cardiff)and he may have been a Stonemason. Any info on dob, parents, anything, please! Sculcoates - Hull - BELL, ATTWOOD, GREEN

Searching for my Gt Gran. AMY GREEN (b 1885 Hull) - she married JAMES ATTWOOD in 1903,had several children - surname Attwood. She then had children by a GEORGE or HARRY BELL - they were my grandad Leonard BELL 1914 - 1946, Morton Attwood BELL 1917, Marion Attwood BELL 1918. Amy lived in the Kate's Terrace, St Paul Street area of Sculcoates. Later at Kingston Terrace, Cumberland St and Northumberland Ave. She then moved to Cardiff & married William Richards in 1923. I have no info about Mr BELL only that on birth certs he is HARRY BELL - fruiterer and on Len's Marriage cert he is GEORGE BELL - Merchant, deceased (BEF 1936). No marriage record of Amy Green / Attwood and a Bell ? Would welcome any info, rumour or suggestion as to Mr BELL the Fruiterer Rob Augustin & Beryl Gorman

I am looking for any information on Augustin Gorman (c1908 - 1970) and Beryl Gorman (possibly nee Moore) born c1918 - died approx 1961). They both lived and had children and died in Hull. Augustin was believed to be originally from Ireland and was also known as Gus. Any information welcome please! Parkin Fisher

Can anyone do a look-up against the marriage of Thomas Parkin and Mary Ann Fisher who married in Holy Trinity Kingston upon Hull 12th April 1831 and see if there is any other details given.i.e. Fathers names etc. Thankyou. Pauline COOKE FAMILY FROM HULL.

MY GRANDAD WAS A TRAWLER SKIPPER IN HULL, HE DIED IN 1962. HE WAS MARRIED TO CARRIE AND HAD 2 DAUGHTERS IRENE AND CAROLINE. AFTER MY GRANDMAS DEATH , ROBERT COOKE, MY GRANDAD ,REMARRIED AND HAD 2 MORE DAUGHTERS. I BELIEVE THAT MY GRANDADS BROTHERS ALSO WORKED ON THE TRAWLERS. I AM UNSURE OF MY GRANDMAS MAIDEN NAME. SHE WAS KNOWN AS CARRIE BUT WAS CAROLINE. DOES ANYONE KNOW OF MY FAMILY? MANY THANKS. Kirk

Any info on the Kirk family.Thomas William Kirk b.1898 married Ellen Davison. He had brothers, that I don't know any details of at all.Father Thomas William Kirk b.1859 married Mary Ann Collingwood (2nd. marriage I think),b 1875,she was adopted by the Kirk family when young. Father Robert Kirk b.1836 married Sarah Kirk 1838. Lapping/Buckley

Looking for any information on my grandparents William Lapping & Ada Buckley. William born circa 1900. Ada had sisters Florence and Violet? William and Ada lived in Hull all the time I was growing up, but would like to know more of their origins. Thomas Lockwood and Caroline Haworth

Thomas and Caroline had four children, lived in Sculcoates, Hull, but where did they marry and where did she come from? He was a merchant. his first wife was Mary Tate from Easingwold, but no idea what happened to her. Always interested to learn more. Wise Family

I am looking for my g.g.grandfather William Wise who was born about 1813 in Hull. He was a mariner and married Ann Gardener from South Shields, Durham 6th Mar 1843. William's father was also William Wise from Hull, and also a mariner. If anyone has any info it would be greatly appreciated. I seem to have come to a dead end. My mother seems to remember something about Kingston upon Hull which would appear to narrow the search abit. Thank you. Milner from Kingston upon Hull

Researching family of Joseph Milner and wife Mary. Their six chn. were born in Horton, Yorkshire. Their son Charles married Matilda Wardle in Sculcoates in 1857 and had seven chn in same area. The family believes there is a plaque to these Milners in the Holy Trinity C of E Church in Hull. Can anyone help? Kath in Australia Thomas Ward b. abt 1837 Hull

Searching for Thomas Ward son of John Ward,a miller,in Hull. Thomas was the master of the "Plato"which was lost with all hands in 1870. Thomas married Ann McCann in Hull in 1859. Ann's father was John McCann (or Meakin or Mason)probably of Glossop,Derbyshire. Children were Annie Ward (m.Eugene Smith) Eliza Harris Ward (m.Herbert Emmanuel Dibb)and Bernard Smith,never married. Any information appreciated. Thompson

Looking for links to Robert Thompson, all I know is that he died in 1823 aged 30. I would love to know who his parents were. I have a John Thompson Saunderson in my family tree born 1849 and married at Christ Church Hull in 1878. Fields

I am looking for any children of Thomas H Fields who was born 1922 to Harold and Edith Fields(Parish) Is Thomas still living? I am not in touch and would like to find these relatives in Hull Hockney/Thurlow/Kelly/Kelley/Emmerson

I am looking for information on my grandfather Thomas Harry Thurlow he was brought up in Hull by a couple called Joseph and Fanny Emmerson so may have been known as Harry Emmerson, his fathers name was either Thomas Kelly or Kelley. He married my grandmother Eva Hockney and spent most of their lives in Kingston Upon Hull john wilson

any information about my father albert wilson born in hull 1898. he was a skipper and died in 1950 of a heart attack at sea. was married to my mother nancy ford. i m trying to find out where he was buried. William Wells/Sophia Cundeth

William married Sophia May 8th 1848 at Hull in the Parish of Holy Trinity. He was a saddler and lived at Porter Street, father John Wells. I should be glad to hear from anyone who knows of them. Thanks Brian Dunns of hestle

Harwichman searching for relatives of the Dunn family, who in the 1901 cenus lived in Chapel yard, Hestle. One fmaily member James dunn (b:1896) married Winifred Massam in 1926. What became of the others? COOK FAMILY,COTTINGHAM NR HULL

Researching my Cook ancesters,any info gratefully received.John cook was born in Cottingham,near Hull,circa 1831,later lived in Hull at Blanket Row in 1881.Any news re the Cook family please. CRAWFORTH family

Looking for anyone with connections to Matthew and Hannah Crawforth living in Paull, Hull, Yorkshire in 1700's. Know that they are cousins that married each other and both were born in 1760's. The sticking point is their parents we have serveral options being John Crawforths and are not sure what to do next in untying the knots. Hope someone can help or is descended from Matthew and Hannah. Lin Lee/Brentnall Yorkshire

William (Coll) Lee born Hull 1867 married Matilda Brentnall from South Shields in 1887. Matilda was the illegitimate child (b.1868)of Anne Matilda Brentnall b. 1849 Escombe - daughter of Joseph Edmund Brentnall (Grocer) William was an entertainer and he travelled with the fairs/auctions around Yorkshire. On 1901 census he was at Mexbrough with daughter Lily (8)-my paternal grandmother- and son Edward(10) Carey Family

Edward Thomas Carey b abt 1876-78 in Hull to Edward and Catherine Carey, married Ellen Valentine Goodall about 1901. Edward died abt 1906 and three sons sent to Canada with Dr. Barnardo's group. Seeking information on exact date and cause of death of Edward. He was a bricklayer employer according to 1901 census. Did Ellen Carey remarry? If so, to whom? Did she have other children? Only remaining granddaugher of Edward and Ellen V. Carey wishes to contact anyone with information about Carey family and plans visit to area in June 06. Many thanks. Virginia
